Introduction

Lee Su-hyun is a South Korean singer signed with YG Entertainment. She is the lead singer of the brother-sister duo AKMU (Akdong Musician) and a part of the duo Hi Suhyun. She also launched her solo career on October 16, 2020, with the digital single “Alien”.

She and her brother debuted on the SBS audition program K-pop Star Season 2. She has also joined reality music shows like Begin Again and served as a judge on the audition show Superband.

In addition to singing, Lee has also explored YouTube with her channel, Leesuhyun, and radio broadcasting with a KBS Cool FM show, AKMU Suhyun’s Volume Up. She received her first award for “Radio DJ Award” at the 16th KBS Entertainment Awards. She has also contributed to original soundtracks for Korean TV dramas such as It’s Okay to Not Be Okay, and the Disney live-action film Mulan.

Fun facts

1
She was home-schooled back in Mongolia.
…
2
She is close with actresses Kim Bora, Kim Saeron and also Red Velvet’s Yeri.
…
3
Suhyun usually turns down photo requests nowadays, as she feels uncomfortable after photos of her were secretly taken many times in the past.
…
4
As of 2023, Chanhyuk’s contact name on Suhyun's phone is “Frog 🐸”. She has previously changed his contact name multiple times, which includes: “AKMU Lee Chanhyuk”, “The man who always keeps his word”, “Happy Man”.
…
5
Suhyun loves Japanese anime and has a big collection of anime figures and lots of cute Cinnamoroll stuff from Sanrio.
…
6
She is learning Japanese. She practices speaking Japanese with N. Flying‘s Hweseung as their levels are relatively the same.
…
7
As of March 2025, she has moved in with Chanhyuk alongside their pet dog Jjome.
